title: Eifion Lewis-Roberts
text:
Eifion Lewis-Roberts (born 13 February 1981 in <a href="St%20Asaph">St Asaph</a>, <a href="Denbighshire">Denbighshire</a>, <a href="Wales">Wales</a>) is a former <a href="Welsh%20people">Welsh</a> international <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. A Prop forward, Roberts was selected for the <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales national rugby union team</a> squad for the Autumn internationals series in October 2008, playing his first game on 14 November against <a href="Canada%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Canada</a>. Roberts is a fluent <a href="Welsh%20language">Welsh</a> speaker.
On 18 January 2010 he was named in the 35-man <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales national Squad</a> for the <a href="2010%20Six%20Nations%20Championship">2010 Six Nations Championship</a>.
Despite interest from clubs in the <a href="Pro14">Celtic League</a> and the French <a href="Top%2014">Top 14</a>, Lewis-Roberts signed a three-year contract with <a href="Sale%20Sharks">Sale Sharks</a> in March 2010. In September the same year, early in the season, Lewis-Roberts suffered an injury to the <a href="anterior%20cruciate%20ligament">anterior cruciate ligament</a> in his knee in a match against <a href="Harlequin%20F.C.">Harlequins</a>. As Lewis-Robert required re-constructive surgery on his knee, he was expected to miss most of the season. He signed for French Top 14 outfit <a href="RC%20Toulonnais">Toulon</a> in 2011 reuniting with <a href="Philippe%20Saint-Andre">Philippe Saint-Andre</a> his former coach at Sale. At the end of the 2011–12 season he returned to <a href="Sale%20Sharks">Sale Sharks</a> as part of a deal which saw <a href="Andrew%20Sheridan">Andrew Sheridan</a> go in the other direction to Toulon.
Lewis-Roberts retired from rugby in September 2017 after suffering a knee injury.
